body.name: 1 X New Forceum HEXA-R 225/50ZR17 98WR Ultra High Performance Tires
body.description: Attention! Due to the size of the tires, Packages might be SEPARATED in the courier facility and not be DELIVERED on the SAME DAY, even though we do ship them together. All tracking information can be checked on courier's website Forceum Hexa-RThe Forceum Hexa-R is a high performance all season tire manufactured for passenger vehicles. The tire has superb summer weather traction, and it grips the road well in wet, dry and winter conditions. However, it isn’t suited for winter driving. The wet traction and hydroplaning resistance are increased with its water dispersing ability. The V-shaped grooves stabilize the tire at high speeds, while the shoulder tread blocks increase the cornering stability, power and ability. The steering responsiveness and accuracy are also improved with the tread pattern and the maintained road contact. The Hexa-R offers a longer lasting tread life. FeaturesAll Season Tire – The tread compound and design provide great all weather traction, and ensure excellent road gripping ability all year round.Hydroplaning Resistance – The V-shaped tread blocks and the unique wide grooves increase the hydroplaning resistance by dispersing water.Stability – The V-shaped tread blocks increase the tire’s high speed driving stability, and enable high speed performance.Cornering Ability – The tread design’s tough shoulder blocks improve the cornering ability and power by providing additional biting edges.Steering Responsiveness – The shoulder tread block pattern also increases the steering responsiveness and accuracy, making the tire easy to control.Longer Tread Life – The driving pressure is equally distributed along the tread area, preventing uneven wear and extending the tread life.

productInformation.value: #12,038 in Automotive (See Top 100 in Automotive) #29 in Passenger Car Performance Tires

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cheap price, but not cheap quality
reviews.reviewText: I had these tires mounted and balanced at discount tire, and have had no complaints about road noise, traction on dry or wet pavement (haven't tried it in snow but those deep grooves should help).Time will tell how the tread wear does, but from what I'm seeing it's a great all-around tire for cheap.Running these on a 2014 VW CC, 235/45R18. Very impressive for the price so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great bang for buck
reviews.reviewText: Purchased these tires 245/40/18 for my son's ford focus ST and I have no regrets. It's a great all around tire. The side walls are a little harder than expected but that makes for great cornering. The tread pattern is great for the rain and it looks really aggressive. I would definitely purchase again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These tires are good so far
reviews.reviewText: My first review on these tires and they are amazing no noise looks good and I every time it rain I test these tires to the max and they hold up at high speeds they don’t break traction if they do then it was deep water but these are so good so far I will be back for my second review on how long they last 👍🏾

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Forceum Hexa-R 245/40/18It was time to replace tires. I never wait until tires bald or start showing threads. I normally replace when the tire’s built-in indicators are near to leveling. In my experience I would still have around 5k miles left until balding at that point.I’ve been running Nanking NS-20 all around for approx a decade. I had many good experiences with Nankang. I discovered Nanking by price. However, I was extremely surprised and I started using them as my “go-to” brand. Commute, necessary drift, cornering never had an issue. So income the need to replace rear shoes. After review lurking I decided to take the same chance with these Forceum Hexa-R as I did w Nankang. The Nans were 500AA and Would get around 20-30k on those Rear shoes, for a RWD pusher. That is for all around driving conditions. The wheels are a staggered setup, the rears are cambered to avoid rubbing during aggressive cornering.Upon arrival I noticed that these Forcerum runners are softer. I then realized they are 400AA. For some reason I thought they were 460AA. So I expect them to give less life than the 500AA Nans. What I did notice that post-mounting these Forceum sidewalls seem to work better for my rear setup. Not much rubbing. But this could be attributed to the mounting lube. Time will tell.The treads are a V which seem to control noise but are more prone to pickup small stones more than my NS20’s, which I dislike. But not a big issue. These Forceum seem to do well in aqua dispersion. It’s hurricane season in FL. First ride after mounting involved coming face to dads with heavy storm rain. Handled perfectly.All in all, I took a chance with these due to small price difference and The COVID money-sucking economy. I’m hopeful that combined with my rear setup that these will be competitive with the NS20 500AA. I’m watching and feeling. Front shoes still have plenty of tread. Normally have to replace front shoes every other rear shoe replacement. So by the time these rear Forcerum shoes wear down the fronts will need it. We’ll see how these go.From the start they get 4 stars. I will update with any issues pos or neg.If all goes well I’ll definitely jump to this brand. If the rear’s do well that’s a given front’s will do just as well being the car is pusher and not puller.Update: 9/4/21It's been a year. Has to go from FL to NY several times. Bad snow storms & these held up. I mean RWD in snow? Crazy.I don't know i put on about 12k mi. on a d still appear to be arpind half life give or take. Not a bad tire at all. I like other threads but these do grip nice on those 90s.I say buy w confidence.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars They seem to be a good budget friendly speed rated tire.
reviews.reviewText: The tires look good. I hadn't heard of these tires before but they drive nice on my 04 gto. They are more budget friendly than most I've looked at. Hopefully they last a little while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We love these all-season tires so much that we've purchased the same couple years ago for both of our cars. The deep tread traction not only gives them a stylish look but also ensures they performvarious weather conditions, from summer heat to winter cold ( exceptionally well in New Hampshire winters. )These tires strike a perfect balance between all-season convenience and winter capability. Highly recommended for their reliability and performance!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Tires shipped faster then expected. Got mounted at local Pep Boys, balanced well. They look and ride awesome, good grip and response as well as feedback. Can't say anything about the wear yet, will see how it goes. We'll worth the price so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
